title: How to Make Avocado Ice Cream

steps.headline: Blend all the ingredients.
steps.description: In a blender, puree the milk, heavy cream, sugar, avocados, and lemon juice. Blend until mixture is creamy and resembles a bright green.

steps.headline: Place the mixture in an ice cream machine.
steps.description: Pour the green mixture in your machine and make the ice cream. Follow you ice cream machine's package instructions to make the ice cream.

steps.headline: Freeze.
steps.description: Place the ice cream in a freezer-safe bowl and have it freeze for about 8 hours to overnight, until the ice cream is cold and solid.

steps.headline: Enjoy!
steps.description: Remove ice cream from freezer. Have it sit for about 10 minutes. Serve and garnish with roasted coconut flakes.

steps.headline: Beat the coconut milk.
steps.description: In a medium-sized bowl, beat the coconut milk until light and fluffy.

steps.headline: Process all the ingredients.
steps.description: In a food processor, blend the avocados, sugar, lemon juice, creamed coconut milk, and mint extract if desired. Blend until mixture is creamy and resembles and bright green.

steps.headline: Place the ice cream in a freezer-safe bowl and have it freeze for about 8 hours to overnight, until the ice cream is cold and solid.

text: Milk Version Blend all the ingredients. In a blender, puree the milk, heavy cream, sugar, avocados, and lemon juice. Blend until mixture is creamy and resembles a bright green. Place the mixture in an ice cream machine. Pour the green mixture in your machine and make the ice cream. Follow you ice cream machine's package instructions to make the ice cream. Freeze. Place the ice cream in a freezer-safe bowl and have it freeze for about 8 hours to overnight, until the ice cream is cold and solid. Enjoy! Remove ice cream from freezer. Have it sit for about 10 minutes. Serve and garnish with roasted coconut flakes. Non-Dairy Version Beat the coconut milk. In a medium-sized bowl, beat the coconut milk until light and fluffy. Process all the ingredients. In a food processor, blend the avocados, sugar, lemon juice, creamed coconut milk, and mint extract if desired. Blend until mixture is creamy and resembles and bright green. Place the ice cream in a freezer-safe bowl and have it freeze for about 8 hours to overnight, until the ice cream is cold and solid.  Enjoy! Remove ice cream from freezer. Have it sit for about 10 minutes. Serve and garnish with roasted coconut flakes.
